reviews.review_msg: Do not take FNST 101 as a GPA booster. Her syllabus is completely different from previous profs. She does not post lecture slides, lectures are mandatory. Grading scale is also tougher, I finished with 84% which was B+, but most profs would have that as A-. The class average ended up as C+, which is a letter grade below coursediggers stated avg.

Avoid taking FNST101 with her for an easy B-Hum credit, she has changed the course so that it is completely different than what you have heard. The only graded materials are 2 papers, and 2 essay based exams, writing intensive. Goes through lecture slides very fast but does not post the pdfs. Unresponsive to criticism despite being asked for it.
